file_content.text: Master Jedi! To speak with the defender of Coruscant and Corellia is quite, quite an honor.
Good day, Master Jedi. How pleasant it is to address the protector of the Rift Alliance!
Ah, Major, what an honor--to speak with one of the Republic's greatest defenders!
Captain! How marvelous to meet the hero of Corellia, the savior of the Republic's finest shipyards!
Greetings! I hate to distract you from the station's glorious Republic architecture, but I'm afraid this is urgent.
The esteemed Supreme Chancellor Saresh has sent a message regarding my former masters, Czerka Corporation.
In recent years, Czerka has suffered many scandals and financial losses. The Republic has been authorized to begin seizing Czerka assets and property. I myself was a Czerka droid!
Czerka Corporation had a lot of skeletons in its closet. Sooner or later, its past was going to catch up.
Czerka has a bad reputation.
Czerka Corporation is hundreds of years old; it has more wealth than some planets. I have trouble imagining it falling apart.
Czerka can't be collapsing.
Certain... events on Tatooine and Corellia have been very damaging, Master Jedi. For Czerka, it's this or bankruptcy.
Czerka did a lot of weapons research, right? Here's hoping some of that tech makes it to the front lines.
Any military assets?
I do hope so, Major. But there is one minor snag--no trouble for you, I'm sure.
Seems life off the corporate ladder is working out for you.
You seem happy about it.
Yes, indeed, Captain! But not everyone agrees.
I think I've heard of Czerka, but I can't quite place the name....
What is Czerka Corporation?
Oh, Czerka Corporation is a pioneer in several fields: droid manufacture, weapons design, biological research and development. Or it was, before this.
I don't think the Republic can just swoop into a corporation's offices and take what it wants.
Seizing assets isn't legal.
No, it's all been negotiated, partly as compensation for Czerka's, er, miscalculations on Corellia.
Sadly, one Czerka facility has gone into lockdown, refusing to hand over its assets. It's a remote moon base, called CZ-198.
CZ-198 is a vital facility. The honorable Chancellor Saresh is anxious to see it secured.
Do we have any idea what Czerka was working on at CZ-198?
Why is the facility special?
Unfortunately, all records on CZ-198 were redacted.
If Czerka Corporation locked CZ-198 down, it probably has something to hide. I should look into it.
So am I.
Our beloved Chancellor Saresh said you should speak with a man called Adjudicator Refain for any details. He's handling the Czerka takeover.
Here is Adjudicator Refain's contact information. Farewell, fellow Republic citizen!
I don't have time to get involved in a Czerka-Republic squabble.
I can't help. [Refuse quest]
That's very disappointing. But, I'm sure you have your reasons. Farewell!
With my reprogramming complete, I welcome the chance to serve the Republic!
